discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #16: Strategic Happiness Core Unit

content.content: Session #16: Strategic Happiness1280×720 711 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #16: Strategic Happiness Core Unit For the 16th episode of CULPS, Andrew Burban (@aburban90) will talk about his proposed Strategic Happiness Core Unit, whose mandate can be boiled down to:  Shitposting  & Airdrops   You can read its subproposal set on the MIPs portal or on the forum. As usual, anyone can join and ask to their heart’s content. @juan will be doing the hosting   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-09-08T16:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number: Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @gov-comms-core-unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Real-World-Finance, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @PaperImperium, @planet_x, @inkymaze, @MakerMan
The full call is now available for review on the MakerDAO Youtube Channel:

After reading the MIP39c2-SP11, this session has cemented the idea that this is a necessary CU within Maker. Kudo’s to @aburban90 for delivering a classic presentation on why this is necessary. You should have been speaking in terms of DAI, not dollars!

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #16  September 8th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  00:29: Presenting Strategic Hapinness CU with Andrew Burban  22:40: Discussion  39:36: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/IZ2A8LNp32I  Introduction  Juan Guillén  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello everyone! Welcome to CULPS #16. We are here with Andrew Burban. We will be discussing the Strategic Happiness Core Unit. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Presentation  Strategic Happiness Core Unit - Forum thread   Andrew Burban 00:29  Front1439×836 114 KB   TableOfContents1440×810 107 KB   Patience1440×827 87.9 KB   Why?1440×800 165 KB   Motivation1440×808 83.9 KB   Mandate1440×823 177 KB   CUMandate1440×811 110 KB   Team1440×809 73.2 KB   History1440×827 90.2 KB   FacilitatorCommitments1433×800 119 KB   UpTo1440×808 77.3 KB   Airdrops1440×808 79.6 KB   YouGotTheStuff?1440×793 115 KB   AfricaBlockChainInstitute1440×818 120 KB   MakerMafia1440×823 132 KB   SwagPhilosophy1440×802 115 KB   SoonTM1439×805 80.7 KB   SwagWorldwide1440×817 105 KB   AirdropCandidates1440×810 117 KB   Shitposts1438×804 167 KB   BetMore1440×806 87.8 KB   Memes1440×829 127 KB   ArtOfShitposting1440×806 110 KB   Vision1440×817 70.7 KB   Image1440×811 91.6 KB   TheSwagWar1440×832 74.6 KB   MulliganQuote1440×812 159 KB   War?1440×800 104 KB   Budget1439×812 71.5 KB   CostBreakdown1440×795 114 KB   PersonalCompensation1440×815 70 KB   ZeroDai1440×789 152 KB   ForeseeableCircumstances1440×808 105 KB   QuaterlyBudget1440×811 108 KB   BudgetUpfront1440×814 169 KB   BudgetRequest1440×801 98.1 KB   FinalThoughts1440×816 116 KB   WizardQuote1440×809 158 KB   Contact1440×796 89.4 KB   Discussion 22:40 - Evyta: I am part of the Talent CU. I got a hoodie from Jeremy. I had to pay some customs. Are you thinking of shipping to people in Europe from Europe to avoid those costs? It is tricky to pay for a gift. 24:24 - Antarctica: Is Maker coming to India? 24:45 - Someone (from chat): Are you planning to expand on digital swags aka NFCs 25:52 - Brian MacMichael: I see this as a grassroots marketing arm from a business perspective. In the past, we have had an enterprise marketing approach. Still, the guerrilla-style marketing that is proposed here is more crypto native. You are going to build more engaged fans who are then going to promote the message for us. If you create this good image out there, we do not have to do it. It would be good for MakerDAO and all of us. 27:18 - Payton Rose: Can you expand on the facilitator role? What differentiates this as a Core Unit as opposed to just applying for funding? 30:20 - Juan Guillén: Can you comment on what you are planning to do on the first three months? 32:23 - Juan Guillén: Some of the incubees on the SES Incubator team said it would be nice to receive something. I am guessing that is the same for PE or other CUs. Potentially there could be some cross coordination between different CUs or partnerships. 34:07: Payton Rose: What about partnerships with existing CUs? Have you thought about how you could collaborate with others at all? For example, you could team up with Growth CU to work with the swag shop. 35:24 - Frank Cruz: Do you see yourself doing something outside of crypto, Twitter, Lisbon, or any of those events? Setting up a booth at festivals where you are going to give away free gear but maybe have the average public take a small test on their phone, make questions on Dai, etc.? 38:39 - Juan Guillén: Any preferred platform for people to reach out to you? Any last comments  Closing Comment  Juan Guillén  Outro 39:36  Thank you to everyone for coming!   Credits   @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #17: Development and UX Core Unit

content.content: image1280×720 54.9 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #17: Development and UX Core Unit For the 17th episode of CULPS, Philip Bain (@bainpm) will talk about the Development and UX Core Unit.  [Its mission is] enabling the best-in-class decentralized decision making for the Maker Protocol by providing a meaningful user experience for all governance participants.  You can read its subproposal set here. As usual, anyone can join and ask to their heart’s content. @juan will be doing the hosting   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-09-22T16:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number: Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @daif-core-unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @planet_x, @PaperImperium, @monet-supply

Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions - Episode #17  September 22nd, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro Juan Guillén  00:54: Discussion and Questions with Philip Bain  57:22: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/MsxoNbJu8as  Introduction  Juan Guillén  Agenda and Preamble 00:00   Hello everyone! Welcome to Core Unit Launch Pod Session #17. My name is Juan, and I am the facilitator from SES CU. Today, we have a group that is very special to us. If they are voted in, that would mean that they are the first successful incubee coming out of the SES Incubator. I am personally very happy about this. Today we are with the DUX CU. They will be speaking more about their application, what they are doing and how they are trying to bring value to Maker.   For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.    Discussion  Development and UX Core Unit subproposal set   Philip Bain 00:54  Launch Pod Session: DUX CU1920×1129 159 KB   Development and UX Core Unit Team1918×1130 173 KB   Mission1916×1128 134 KB   Vision1920×1101 110 KB   Vision1920×1112 159 KB   Facilitating the decision making process1920×1111 183 KB   Ensuring protocol and user security1917×1115 168 KB   Bringing Governance forward1919×1090 151 KB   Strategy1920×1090 124 KB   Five stages of Strategy1920×1084 116 KB   Discover and Define1920×1091 198 KB   Discover1920×1093 166 KB   Polkadot Competitor Analysis1920×1101 165 KB   Indexed Competitor Analysis1920×1086 149 KB   dYdX/Discussions1920×1111 188 KB   Discover-Series of 1:1 interview with MKR holders1917×1098 188 KB   Discover-External Research1919×1117 179 KB   Discover-Ideation1920×1115 103 KB   Discover-Ideation1920×1101 169 KB   Maker UX idea board1920×1097 208 KB   Define1920×1104 173 KB   Define1920×1084 96.4 KB   Define1920×1130 152 KB   Design & Develop, Deliver, Analyse & Reflect1920×1101 113 KB   Design & Develop1920×1106 157 KB   Design & Develop1920×1092 130 KB   Design & Develop1920×1104 195 KB   Deliver-Delivering Quality Work1920×1053 158 KB   Deliver-Governance Portal Release1920×1121 225 KB   Deliver-QA Processes1920×1107 138 KB   Delivery-Vote Delegation-Technical Diagram1920×1093 109 KB   Analyse & Reflect1898×1095 142 KB   Budget1920×1108 122 KB   Budget1918×1103 199 KB   Budget1920×1120 177 KB   Prioritization & Roadmap1920×1118 132 KB   Prioritization1920×1121 118 KB   Roadmap1920×1101 209 KB   Roadmap-Prioritized work1920×1097 185 KB   Questions1920×1093 101 KB   Questions 05:36 - Juan Guillén: You commented about EPNS. Can you quickly say what it is and why is that important, and how will it work? 35:41 - Retro: I would love to hear your perspective on  solidifying talent within your team for L2 or collaborating with other CUs for that purpose for Governance? 37:03 - Juan Guillén: Can you comment on the legal side and why is this needed? Why a team like yours might be liable? Why is it a good practice to have a buffer? 38:27 - Juan Guillén: Can you speak about openness and transparency? Are you planning any open calls to discuss the backlog, how is evolving, discuss features, get feedback? What are your plans regarding that? 41:18 - Michael Aparicio: How many tokens do you have to pull to be part of the governing body? 43:11 - Frank Cruz: How do you plan to communicate with CUs when it comes to front-end and back-in integrations? Is that something that is going to be weekly, monthly? How is that going to work? Do you see any issues that can arise? 45:17 - Frank Cruz: Are you thinking of working something out with Maker Discourse, as far as making it easier and more attractive? 50:54 - Someone: Regarding the roadmap, is there anything on the radar regarding creating more transparency around what goes into an executive vote, especially the spell? What is the feature of the on-chain effects? Are there other mechanisms to improve the transparency for executive spells? 54:37 - Juan Guillén: Can you comment on the current status of the poll? 55:53 - Juan Guillén: Where is the good place to find you, submit questions, reach your team?  Closing Comment  Juan Guillén  Outro 57:22  We can keep the discussions going at the forum. For voting, go to the voting portal. Thank you to everyone for coming!   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
The full call is now available for review on the MakerDAO Youtube Channel:

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #22: TechOps Core Unit

content.content: image1280×720 46 KB  Join us for the 22nd episode of CULPS as we hear from Dumitru Zavrotschi @dumitru and Simon KP @simonkp on their proposed TechOps Core Unit. The TechOps Core Unit has a vision of providing support to the MakerDAO infrastructure layer, enabling a secure, reliable, and transparent ecosystem in order to improve MakerDAO’s agility and resilience. Join us for this deep dive into the TechOps Core Unit.  MIP39c2-SP29: Adding TechOps Core Unit (TOCU-001) MIP40c3-SP54: TechOps Core Unit MKR Budget MIP40c3-SP53: TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget MIP41c4-SP31: TechOps Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - Simon Kelada-Polupanov MIP41c4-SP30: TechOps Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - Dumitru Zavrotschi   Join us! CULPS Master of Ceremonies @juan will be our host   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-12-15T18:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number:Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @Protocol-Engineering, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @dux-core-unit, @collateral-core-unit, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @flipflopflapdelegate, @MakerMan, @ultraschuppi, @monet-supply

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #22  December 15th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan  00:53: Discussion with Simon Kelada-Polupanov & Dumitru Zavrotschi from TechOps CU  1:03:07: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/XPskVQbCpik  Introduction  Juan  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hi to everyone. Welcome to the Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions #22. Today we have TechOps CU. They have been with the Maker Foundation for a long time, back in the day. Now they are transitioning to the DAO, as many other teams have. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Discussion  MIP39c2-SP29: Adding TechOps Core Unit (TOCU-001) - Forum thread   Simon Kelada-Polupanov & Dumitru Zavrotschi 00:53  Tech Ops Core Unit1920×1024 207 KB   Mission1907×1014 228 KB   Contents1920×1009 187 KB   01 TechOps Team1919×1017 211 KB   The Dream Team1920×1005 134 KB   We are distributed for 24/7 coverage1920×1007 155 KB   Vision1920×1009 172 KB   Vision1920×1010 208 KB   Vision - infrastructure1920×1017 210 KB   Vision - collaboration1920×1017 223 KB   Current & Anticipated Challenges1920×1027 215 KB   Strategy1920×1009 172 KB   Continuous improvement cycle1920×1026 110 KB   Plan1920×1024 184 KB   Plan1920×1019 219 KB   Provision Infrastructure1920×1008 198 KB   Infrastructure as Code1920×1026 203 KB   App Building & Continuous Delivery1920×1007 206 KB   Continuous Delivery Sequence1920×1014 221 KB   Monitoring Applications, Protocol & Infrastructure1920×1017 215 KB   Monitoring Components1920×1013 194 KB   Continuous Feedback & Transparency1920×1022 206 KB   Continuous Feedback & Transparency1920×1018 213 KB   Repeat1920×1019 187 KB   Budget1920×1013 173 KB   Monthly & Quarterly DAI Budget Cap1920×1013 218 KB   MKR Incentive1920×1013 226 KB   Services1920×1016 175 KB   Our Services1920×1014 225 KB   Infrastructure Hosting1920×1005 192 KB   Dashboards - Collateral Prices1920×1022 211 KB   Dashboards - Oracle Feeds1920×1016 200 KB   Dashboards - Liquidations1920×1009 221 KB   Alerts from different sources1920×1024 208 KB   Thank you!1920×1011 196 KB   Questions 39:40 - Walter: How often are we testing an LN monitoring and alerting? 40:35 - Walter: How do we verify? 42:02 - Frank: What are your thoughts about building burner email to alert MKR token? 44:55 - Someone: How do we react on incidents? 47:08 - Payton Rose: As we get more and more CUs, how will you be prioritizing requests between them? 48:42 - Payton Rose: In terms of letting the community know where things fall on the pipeline, will there be a way to get a public list essentially for CU requests? 50:06 - Juan: Right now, the budget you are getting is mainly from the DAO to service other CUs needs. Since you are not asking for a budget, how do you prevent, for example, some low priority CU coming and saying: I need three full archive notes, and I am not going to even use them or some crazy request without charging for a budget? Since the money aspect is that the DAO pays for all these services almost for free for the CUs to use, how do you prioritize? 52:13 - Juan: What is the basic package of infrastructure and where do you draw the line? 54:55 - Frank: You are scaling to seven or nine employees. What is your strategy for onboarding the extra three, four, five people? Regarding burnout, how do you make adjustments in team size and with the working hours? 56:48 - Frank: Do you have a public roadmap? 1:00:53 - Someone: Do you have a status page or any  metrics you are tracking to quantify the work being done? 1:02:00 - Juan: Is there anything else that you would like to mention before closing the call?  Closing Comment  Juan  Outro 1:03:07  Dumitru shared a dashboard of the different services and tracking them online. We will see this MIPset going into formal submission for the next cycle. If anyone watching later has any questions or feedback, feel free to post it in the forum. Let us keep the conversation going. Thank you to everyone for joining.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
This full call is now available on the MakerDAO Youtube channel:

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #15: StarkNet Engineering Core Unit SNE-001

content.content: CULPS #15: StarkNet Engineering Core Unit1280×720 740 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #15: StarkNet Engineering Core Unit SNE-001 For the 15th episode we’ll have Louis Merkle (@pyramidmaker) talking about the proposed StarkNet Engineering Core Unit, whose aim is to build a DAI bridge over Starknet. You can find the Core Unit proposal set here. As usual, anyone can join and ask to their heart’s content. @juan will be doing the hosting   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-09-01T16:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number: Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @g_dip, @planet_x, @iammeeoh, @ultraschuppi, @ejbarraza
This full call is now available for review on the MakerDAO Youtube channel:

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #15  September 2th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  00:40: Presenting StarkNet Engineering CU & Discussion with Louis Baudoin and Ohad Barta  55:36: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/rv57kG1upnI  Introduction  Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #15: StarkNet Engineering Core Unit SNE-001   Juan Guillén  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello everyone! Welcome to Core Unit Launch Pod Session #15. We are exploring the StarkNet Engineering CU. We are with Louis Merkle and the team. They will be explaining what they are working for. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Presentation & Discussion  Louis Baudoin and Ohad Barta 00:40  1432×767 97.6 KB   MultichainEnvironment1440×777 121 KB   WhoIsStarkware?1440×779 124 KB   MakerOverStarkwareSummary1440×776 140 KB    10:08 - Payton Rose: In terms of the bridge, can you give some context on what it provides to the Maker community? Is there Dai on StarkNet right now? How are bridges occurring? How important is this bridge for the community?   11:47 - David Utrobin: What is the difference between Starknet and other L2s, specifically Arbitrum and Optimism?   15:39 - Juan Guillén: Regarding Phase 1, is there any possibility that the results give you the idea that this should not continue? Say you reach a stage where you find out it is not worth pursuing and decide to stop everything. Is that under consideration?   17:20 - Juan Guillén: You mentioned that there would be the need to re-evaluate the resources after Phase 1, right?   19:19 - PE team’s perspective about the proposal - by Bartek   21:15 - Frank Cruz: Is this going to be rolled out as a Validium, not as ZK-Rollup, or the other way round?   24:12 - Payton Rose: I do not know if this is a question for PE or the StarkNet team. Have you considered testing the integration with the PSMs? This question might need to be addressed by PE.   25:55 - Juan Guillén: This might also be a question for PE. Is it an industry standard to subsidize this type of project? For example, did DYDX pay for this, or was it something unique to Maker because of the CU setup?   28:26 - Planet_X: Regarding making a bridge, in this case, a Dai bridge between Ethereum and StarkNet, what is the core competency of making it? Why you and not anyone else?     RiskMitigation1440×790 113 KB    35:32 - Frank Cruz: About the fee structure, is Maker and StarkNet going to front the withdrawals? Is Maker expected to put up some of that money? Is that part of the reason why we are going to start with 1000 Dai?   41:16 - Frank Cruz: The gas optimization for DYDX is high. Has that come down at all? Do you have numbers of what is DYDX compared to DeversiFi?   43:14 - Someone: Can you elaborate on self-custodial bridges? How will that be achieved?   45:20 - Juan Guillén: It is nice to see the endorsement from the PE. It signals that it has been reviewed by people we trust.   45:50 - Frank Cruz: Would it be possible in the future to find some way of giving back to Maker treasury Starkware tokens if they ever come into fruition? I am not sure if you can answer that.   47:16 - Frank Cruz: It would be good if you posted in the forum some agreement with the PE CU.   50:37 - Frank Cruz: What you are saying is that the StarkWare people are going to hand over any annotated coding? Learning Cairo is something PE will have to take up on their own, or is Starkware going to have a hand in that?   52:50 - Juan Guillén: There is there Special Purpose Fund MIP (MIP55), which allows to draw Dai from the surplus buffer to get something done. If a risk or feasibility study needed to be done, this would be a potential route. I was wondering if you have considered that or you want to take the CU path?   54:45 - Juan Guillén: For those interested, where can they find you? What is the best way to send you questions or comments?    Closing Comment  Juan Guillén  Outro 55:36  We keep the discussions going at the forum. Thank you, Louis, Ohad, and everyone else, for joining us. As always, really good comments and questions. I will see you around!   Credits   @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #19: Deco Fixed Rate

content.content: 1280×720 707 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #19: Deco Fixed Rate For the 19th episode of CULPS, Vamsi Alluri (@Vamsi) will be presenting the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit, whose purpose is to bring fixed rate vaults to Maker using the Deco fixed rate protocol:  MIP39c2-SP23: Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit MIP40c2-SP35: Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit Budget MIP40c3-SP36: Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit MKR Budget MIP41c4-SP24: Facilitator Onboarding, Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit  As usual, anyone can join and ask question. @juan will be doing the hosting   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-10-13T16:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number:Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @gov-comms-core-unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Real-World-Finance, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @PaperImperium, @planet_x, @inkymaze, @MakerMan
This full call is now available for review on the MakerDAO Youtube channel:

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #19  October 13th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro Juan Guillén  00:32: Discussion with Vamsi Alluri  56:50: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/WNdOqbucikw  Introduction  Juan Guillén  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hi to everyone. Welcome to the Core Unit Launch Pod Session. My name is Juan, and I am the facilitator of SES CU at Maker. I am here with people interested in Maker. This is episode #19. Today we are joined by the Deco Fixed Rate solution, and they are going to be explaining a bit more what Deco is and their proposal in the forum. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Discussion  [MIP39c2-SP23: Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit - Forum thread]((MIP39c2-SP23: Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit)   Vamsi Alluri 00:32  Deco1920×1092 188 KB   Experience at Maker1920×1095 222 KB   Experience outside Maker1920×1097 148 KB   Deco Enhances MakerDAO1920×1093 223 KB   Claim Token Hedge Fees1920×1093 195 KB   What's in a Fee Token1920×1100 229 KB   Questions1920×1091 80.1 KB   Questions 05:59 - A D: How are fixed rates set? For example, Institutional Vaults set a fixed rate. How did they do that? Do they took the current stability fee and negotiated down from there? Are you saying this would provide more information in these decision-making environments? 8:06 - David Utrobin: Through the TLM, the rates are set via Maker Governance. Whereas with Deco, the claim fee token price is discovered on the free market. Is the free market setting the rates or Maker? 12:52 - A D: The reason the vote is not proceeding is that people are concerned that these are yield tokens. Yield tokens, similar to DSR, represent some potential regulatory risk. Could this be structured so that the concerns are abated and irrelevant to the product? 14:18 - A D: In terms of the growth strategy, you have already spoken to both Growth and Oasis. Can you talk about your conversation with Oasis? 15:49 - A D: We currently have the floor for the Dai debt that qualifies an Institutional Vault, and it is 200 million. Right now, there is not a means to have a scalable on-ramp. Nadia suggested implementing Deco to turn Institutional Vaults over to them and use it as a way to on-ramp smaller users so that they can have scalable means. Do you think that this could meet that requirement? 17:22 - David Utrobin: Is the fee token a yield token? Is there a regulatory risk? 19:13 - David Utrobin: You talked about the claim fee tokens having rate discovery in a free market. Where does that happen if you abstract it all away in the CDP Manager? 23:44 - A D: One thing that was overlooked in this proposal is your current collaboration with PE in the Sandbox project. Most voters are not aware that by funding Deco in this proposal, Deco will be the first external integration written into the core of Maker smart contracts. Part of what will come out of this is the first processing procedures in collaboration with PE and SES to enable parallel smart contract development, which is a pretty significant blocker and a feature that would be added. Could you talk about this? 28:17 - Rune: There is tension around the proposal as it is proposed with the fixed and performance payments. But also concerning the concept of competition between the different proposals and the concept of an official Maker fixed-rates designation and what that means in terms of favoring one project over the other. These dynamics are important to consider. Can you talk in that direction? 31:48 - Bruno: Could you go through the fixed costs? Is it a plan of three years, and is there a fee share? Can you give some details? 35:18 - Rune: Is it two million for a three-year period? Is this the salaries? 37:01 - Rune: What is the MKR amount in total? 37:40 - Rune: The cash is the salary that is doing the work. Does the MKR represent the bonus and it is the value that you are providing to Maker and sharing? 38:08 - Rune: The point is that eventually, this turns self-sustainable. There are two options. The communist option where Maker buys it out and runs it as this native thing that is the official Maker fixed-rates and status. That is where Maker goes for economies of scale, pays it all, does it all, and focuses everything on this approach. The other option is more of a free market. You took the risk in creating this proposal and bringing it to governance. Now you will fully de-risk the actual work or the next three years of building and integrating and setting it up. From there, it has been set up a fixed-rate protocol that has a team attached to it that is getting a profit share. Their goal will be to integrate that everywhere, spread it, grow it, maintain it, so they can keep getting that profit share over time.  When this profit share thing is in place, an additional implicit negotiation has to occur, an expectation that is part of it, which is Deco protocols integration into frontends around the ecosystem to the extent that Maker can influence that. If we assume that Maker cannot influence that, then this does not matter. Oasis will integrate whatever they want, whenever they want to integrate. Because it is a private company, they will integrate whatever gives them the cheapest rate. How much of Maker’s stability appetite is funneled into this thing? This directly impacts the performance fee that you get. There is also a connection between that and the marketplace you create on the other side of people buying into it. Because Maker wants to lock in its fixed rates into the different markets. What do you think of that? 46:47 - Rune: What happens if Maker voters decide to off-board the CU? 49:50 - David Utrobin: If we were to not go with Deco, for example, and go with Pairwyse or TLM. How do we do it? Do we give Growth this initiative? Would they need their CUs? What is the best path for Maker from a business standpoint? So far, Deco has the incentives and everything kind of right, and I like where it is going. 53:24 - David Utrobin: Although Deco does not need PE in the same way the others might, would Deco still need to engage PE during solution design coordination? Is it that no matter what, there will be overlapping coordination that has to happen? 56:34 - Juan Guillén: Vamsi, what is the best way to reach you if there are any questions or comments?  Closing Comment  Juan Guillén  Outro 56:50  Thank you to all for coming. It was great having you. See you around.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #23: Maker Talent Core Unit

content.content: 1280×720 794 KB  Join us for the 23rd episode of CULPS as we hear from Mano Ventura Barreira @manomad  on the proposed Maker Talent Core Unit. The Maker Talent Core Unit’s vision is to be a one-stop-shop for attracting best-in-class talent across the blockchain, using innovative social recruiting to create an outstanding candidate experience for recruitees. Don’t miss this deep dive into the future of talent acquisition at MakerDAO.  MIP39c2-SP28: Adding Maker Talent Core Unit MIP40c3-SP50: Modify Core Unit Budget - Maker Talent MIP40c3-SP51: Modify Core Unit Budget (MKR) - Maker Talent MIP41c4-SP29: Facilitator Onboarding for Maker Talent Core Unit   Join us! This session will be co-hosted by @Juan & @Retro   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-01-19T18:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number:Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @daif-core-unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @happiness-core-unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @dux-core-unit, @starknet-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @collateral-core-unit, @Recognized-Delegates

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #23  January 19th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  01:00: Presentation  11:46: Discussion with Mano Ventura Barreira  40:28: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/E3K3DhsNugM  Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello to everyone. Thank you for joining episode #23 of CULPS. I am Retro, a contributor with the SES CU at MakerDAO. Today I have the pleasure of being joined by Mano Ventura Barreira from the proposed Maker Talent CU. Maker Talent is a team that SES is currently incubating to address the needs of attracting top talent to MakerDAO. The need for Maker Talent is highlighted by another SES research project called X-Ray, where our team is mapping out the journey of contributors, specifically developers, from Web 2.0 to Web 3.0. Project X-Ray has invested months of effort into mapping out the developer journeys. Maker Talent will now introduce us to their CU mandate of unlocking comparable insights for all roles at the DAO. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Discussion  MIP39c2-SP28: Adding Maker Talent Core Unit (MT-001)   Presentation 01:00  MakerTalent CU(RFC)1920×1173 170 KB   Agenda1920×1120 115 KB   Update/Change in Scope1920×1136 188 KB   Update/Vision1920×1178 140 KB   Update/Mission1919×1136 142 KB   Update/Strategy1920×1127 203 KB   Update/Priorities 2022-11920×1124 244 KB   Update/Priorities 2022-21920×1113 174 KB   Update/Priorities 2022-31920×1098 167 KB   Update/Road Map 20221920×1113 204 KB   Next Steps1920×1113 141 KB   Contact1920×1113 175 KB   Q&A1920×1107 77.1 KB   Questions 11:46 12:11 - Retro: You said to democratize people practices. It sounds like you will be conducting more stakeholder interviews with contributors rather than the facilitator. Is that true? 13:25 - Frank Cruz: Do you see yourself more as an HR team, where you are not only pulling in the best talent possible but also helping with the onboarding? Whew you learning how to report back to the MKR token holders but also being that in-between where you are having the best interest of the new hires coming into MakerDAO? 19:39 - Frank Cruz: How can we improve the slowdowns of onboarding and delaying productive new team members that you onboard? 21:59 - Frank Cruz: How does DAO should be incentivizing individuals to come and work on this side of the world? 24:51 - Someone: Could you talk about the work that you are doing with the CUs under there? 27:29 - Someone: Do you have a few examples of how you interact with the CUs and the results that we got from that? 33:53 - Someone: How do you surface the hiring needs within a DAO? Talking to the CUs will only give you these micro perspectives on their scope and problems but not necessarily at the level of the DAO. Is that something that you have been thinking about on how to deal with that? 38:10 - Someone: You brought the idea of the internal job market. Is that this idea of organizing the marketplace of opportunities in the one-hand candidates, on the other hand, to continuously reignite people’s interests by presenting them with new opportunities within the DAO? 39:16 - Someone: Do you have examples of other companies and what they are doing, or is this like an own practice? 40:19 - Retro: Do you have any last thing to say?  Closing Comment  Retro  Outro 41:04  Thank you.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
Getting ready!!!
This full call is now available on the MakerDAO Youtube channel for review:

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #21: Immunefi Security Core Unit

content.content: 1280×720 576 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #21: Immunefi Security Core Unit Join us for the 21st episode of CULPS as we hear from the proposed Immunefi Core Unit team. This Core Unit Launch Pod Session marks the first extensive collaboration between decentralized organizations. Immunefi is the largest bug bounty platform in Crypto, and its co-founder  -Travin Keith @travinimmunefi - is slated to be this Core Unit’s facilitator. On this episode, we will learn how Immunefi can systematically improve security for builders, end users, and other stakeholders in the Maker Ecosystem by providing both reactive and proactive security services.  MIP39c2-SP24: Adding Immunefi Security Core Unit - IS-001 MIP40c3-SP41: Immunefi Security Core Unit MKR Budget - IS-001 MIP40c3-SP42: Adding Immunefi Security Core Unit Budget - IS-001 MIP41c4-SP25: Immunefi Security Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - IS-001   Join us! CULPS Master of Ceremonies @juan will be our host   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-11-16T18:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @Protocol-Engineering, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @starknet-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @inkymaze, @MakerMan, @ultraschuppi

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #21  November 16th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  00:43: Discussion with Travin Keith and Joshua Pritikin  39:43: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/oftcdpvEOUA  Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello to everyone. Welcome to Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions episode #21. I am Retro. I am a contributor with the SES CU at MakerDAO. Today I am joined with the proposed CU team for Immunefi. Immunefi proposal is currently in the formal submission phase with about five days left with over 50000 yes votes, no no votes, and no abstaining votes. Immunefi represents the first decentralized collaboration between decentralized organizations. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Discussion  MIP39c2-SP24: Adding Immunefi Security Core Unit - IS-001 - Forum thread   Travin Keith and Joshua Pritikin 00:43  Immunefi Security CU1920×1088 146 KB   Mission1920×1087 136 KB   Collaboration Between Decentralized Organizations1920×1098 110 KB   Largest bug bounty platform in crypto1920×1101 104 KB   Team Setup1920×1097 146 KB   Travin Keith1920×1089 189 KB   Joshua Pritikin1920×1091 174 KB   External Partners1920×1085 182 KB   Vision1920×1093 155 KB   All Services1919×1097 149 KB   Security Operations1920×1097 124 KB   Identification of Critical Infrastructure1891×1087 131 KB   In Collaboration with Defisafety1920×1096 133 KB   Bug Bounty Program1920×1102 183 KB   Additional Triaging of Bug Reports by Chainsecurity1920×1082 160 KB   Fei Protocol1920×1101 151 KB   1905×1084 166 KB   Incident Response Facilitation1918×1085 220 KB   Inside the War Room That Saved Primitive Finance1920×1087 163 KB   Community Support1920×1088 114 KB   Core Unit Operational Audits1920×1093 126 KB   In Collaboration with Defisafety1920×1116 121 KB   Education and Advisory1920×1092 144 KB   The Malware That Swaps Your Address And Drains Your Wallet1920×1081 148 KB   Roadmap1920×1094 108 KB   November 20211920×1098 150 KB   December 20211920×1093 151 KB   January 20211920×1094 163 KB   February 20211920×1097 143 KB   Budgeting1920×1082 113 KB   Monthly/Quarterly1920×1102 137 KB   Yearly1920×1099 115 KB   One Time Expenses1920×1079 127 KB   MKR Expenditure1920×1079 141 KB   MKR Expenditure Parameters1920×1076 171 KB   FAQ1920×1080 103 KB   FAQ1920×1079 144 KB   Immunefi Security CU1920×1081 152 KB   Questions 28:11 - Retro: What do you identify that would make Maker’s Bounty program one of the industry leaders?  29:54 - David Utrobin: Is your team thinking about recruiting more security researchers to provide something like an in-house auditing firm that the engineering teams can fall back or use as support? 31:48 - Retro: What is the process surrounding defining the security risks for the personnel? What are the initial steps that you are envisioning that can make Maker’s personnel security more robust? 34:36 - Retro: Do you have plans to expand, or is it something that you will shoulder and continue carrying for the near and mid future? 36:50 - Retro: What is your philosophy on proactiveness and reactiveness, especially with security? Do you have a defined framework that Immunefi follows to try to prioritize some of these tasks being reactive or proactive, or is it more of a case by case or protocol by protocol approach for developing that framework? 38:44 - Retro: Is there any last-minute thing that you would like to include? What is the best way to get a hold of you?  Closing Comment  Retro  Outro 39:43  We will update the forum post for the CULP call with the recording and relevant links to get a hold of you. I am very excited to see the outcome of the formal submission trending in the right direction and to see the work you produce. Thank you to everyone for joining the call, especially Travin and Joshua. I hope that everyone has a great rest of their day.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #18: MakerLabs

content.content: 1280×720 744 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #18: MakerLabs For the 18th episode of CULPS, Tim Schuppener (@ultraschuppi) will be presenting the MakerLabs Core Unit, whose purpose is to provide pathways for revolutionary product ideas. Subproposals can be found here:  MIP39c2-SP21: Adding MakerLabs Core Unit MIP40c2-SP32: Adding MakerLabs Core Unit Budget MIP41c2-SP22: Facilitator Onboarding (MakerLabs)  As usual, anyone can join and ask question to their heart’s content. @juan will be doing the hosting   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-10-06T16:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number:Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @gov-comms-core-unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Real-World-Finance, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @PaperImperium, @planet_x, @inkymaze, @MakerMan

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #18  October 6th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  00:58: Discussion and Questions about MakerLabs CU with Collin Raddatz, Adam Urban, and Tim Schuppener.  53:56: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/DJrFgI7zjrk  Introduction  Juan Guillén  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hi to everyone. Welcome to Core Unit Launch Session episode #18. My name is Juan. I am the facilitator from SES CU. I am joined by a group of people interested in everything CU-related. Today we are with the “to be” team from MakerLabs CU. Collin Raddatz, Adam Urban, and Tim Schuppener will be telling us what all this is about. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Tim Schuppener 00:49  1920×1056 98.6 KB   Our Story1920×1073 132 KB   Our Team1920×1063 89.9 KB   1920×1064 152 KB   Tim1920×1068 177 KB   Collin1920×1054 171 KB   Adam1920×1058 178 KB   Maker Delegates Stats1920×1078 188 KB   eurDAI1920×1073 117 KB   Next Months1920×1071 136 KB   Questions 16:40 - Someone: From a very pragmatic perspective, I heard from the team members that you intend to quit your current job to become this MVP Unit for Maker. I do not see a roadmap beyond three months, and the value of the CU is still not demonstrated. It is important to understand and to demonstrate the value in advance of burning the ship. You do not burn the ship before it is too close to shore. I saw a one-quarter road map, and the cost is significant. 20:35 - Someone: What is the life cycle of eurDAI? You would take it, run it, get it operational. Then where does it go? Who maintains it? PE is quite backlogged. One of the issues with Maker is that the CU is the only structure. I heard from you that it would be analogous to being a third-party service provider, putting a proposal for each product forward, and then letting Maker sign off the projects and fund them. We do not have that structure. The CU is the most effective structure right now. The question is in two parts. What happens with the products after? Who is going to maintain them because we do not have that technical talent? Let’s say on the fourth month, nobody is willing to take it on. Are you still going to operate eurDAI? Are you willing to do that and to commit to that? On the other side, what about doing these MVPs and testing? We need people who will own the projects end-to-end. Otherwise, we end up in a position where there is nobody to take it over, and we end up with a bunch of underdeveloped products. 23:46 - Frank Cruz: Is it fair to say that MakerLabs, this possible CU, can create a prototype but cannot maintain it? Is that correct? If you create the next prototype besides eurDAI, is this something that someone like PE will have to take over? Also, would it be possible to work with someone like StarkNet CU? How do you see the role of MakerLabs in the development of CK rollups, Layer2s? Do you have any experience in that, and can you build a prototype for that? Are you going to build the prototype and let someone else maintain it? 29:50 - Planet_X: How minimal is the minimal viable products (MVP)? Is it so minimal that only developers can play with it? Or will it include the graphical user interfaces and everything so that the wider community can interact with it? 32:55 - Planet_X: Let’s say that the MVP is working but that nobody picks up on it in the Maker organization afterward. Would it be possible to use bug bounties - paying people to try to hack it - to harden the product for scaling it beyond the first handful of million eurDai? 35:06 - Planet_X: What is the longest project you have been involved with? 36:30 - Juan Guillén: Regarding the eurDAI, you mentioned something about doing legal research to see if it was feasible. Let’s say that it is not for any given reason or that there will be too much risk involved for you three or the DAO in general. Do you have a Plan B to work on, or is it something that you would see down the line? 38:24 - Payton Rose: In terms of how you might be sourcing community input. Are you looking to get suggestions or ask from CUs? Is this something that is going to be more forum or call-based? Have you thought about that? 39:58 - RoJo: The first project that you will be working on is eurDAI. As you move along, you will assess whether or not that is a viable product based upon a variety of factors like inputs from the community, your team, and others. If you decide that it is not a project that you want to move forward with. Are you willing to take input and feedback from the community to work on whatever the next thing is that the community deems necessary for the protocol? 41:08 - RoJo: In a lot of organizations that I have been involved with, there have been labs, like you propose, or some sort of incubator or skunkworks that happens inside of the organization. The projects that they work on a lot of times are dictated by other factors besides the community. I heard several comments about how you like the bootstrap stuff. I appreciate that because I think innovations are needed in the protocol. At the same time, sometimes there is work that you do not like to do, but it is necessary. Can you give us your thoughts on that? We are not going to throw work and tell you what you have to work on without letting you have any input. I am not suggesting that at all. 44:17 - LongForWisdom: If the community decides or thinks we should be working on some other cool new awesome project rather than eurDAI. Would you consider moving to that? I am imagining a hypothetical scenario where the DAO suddenly decides that we are going in a whole new direction. If eurDAI does not fit into that direction for whatever reason, even before the black product market has been approved for eurDAI, would you consider moving to something else if it was something you are aligned with? 47:07 - Frank Cruz: If someone said that MakerDAO is more in need of maintenance and quality products versus prototypes. Because we need teams, CUs, that can make things from the start to go live and to be able to pivot. What would your answer be to someone who is an opponent to that? 48:59 - Frank Cruz: Besides the community giving you feedback, how do you get product/market fit for different regions of the world? South America has a different view on financial freedom versus Germany. How do you get a vision of what product/market fit DAI can play well in the sandbox? 51:00 - Frank Cruz: Is MakerLabs more designed for someone who is looking for the value proposition versus the grow proposition? 51:43 - Juan Guillén: What is the best way to contact you for anyone watching this later? 52:12 - Juan Guillén: Anything else that the MakerLabs team would like to add?  Closing Comment  Juan Guillén  Outro 53:56  Thanks to everyone for coming. It was great having you. Let’s keep the discussions going at forum.maker.com. I will see you everyone around.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

Thanks everybody who joined the party tonight. I really liked the conversation with you! Just do me one favor and do not abstain - if you don’t like it, please vote against the proposal. I rather get this plan destroyed right now. happy to answer any follow up questions over here or by DM
This full call is now available for review on the MakerDAO Youtube channel:

discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #20: Sidestream Auction Services

content.content: 1280×720 713 KB    Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions ||| Session #20: Sidestream Auction Services  CULPS is celebrating the big 2-0 with a double feature this week! For the 20th episode of CULPS, Daniel Kremerov (@danik) will be presenting the Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit, whose purpose is to improve security and transparency of the Maker Protocol by providing auction service through open-source development.  MIP39c2-SP25: Adding Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit MIP40c3-SP43: Adding Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget MIP40c3-SP44: Adding Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit MKR Budget MIP41c4-SP26: Sidestream Auction Services Facilitator Onboarding  Join us on a new day, with the same host. @juan will be hosting a special Thursday edition of CULPS to sneak in Sidestream before Liscon next week.    When Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-10-14T16:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where When the time is ripe, follow this Zoom link  Or use this information:  Meeting ID: 829 4277 3725 Passcode: COREUNIT Find your local number:Zoom International Dial-in Numbers - Zoom  attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Content-Production, @gov-comms-core-unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Real-World-Finance, @MakerMikeP, @Coulter, @twblack88, @flipflopflapdelegate, @PaperImperium, @planet_x, @inkymaze, @MakerMan
The full call is now available for review on the MakerDAO Youtube Channel:

Core Unit Launch Pod Session - Episode #20  October 14th, 2021  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  00:57: Discussion with Daniel Kremerov and Lukas Steib  31:56: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/kho5870UY2E  Introduction  Juan Guillén  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello! Welcome to Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions episode #20. My name is Juan. I am the facilitator at the SES CU. One of our initiatives is to run an incubation program to ensure that teams get what they need to be independent CUs. Today I am joined by the Sidestream Auction Services team, which is part of the incubation program. I am looking forward to this presentation and to seeing what the team has prepared for everyone. For other episodes of CULPS, please check the forum.   Discussion  MIP39c2-SP25: Adding Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit - SAS-001   Daniel Kremerov and Lukas Steib 00:57  Sidestream Auction Services1920×1118 161 KB   Agenda1920×1119 95.3 KB   Mission1920×1118 153 KB   Team Background1920×1109 114 KB   Team1920×1114 111 KB   Motivation for Auction Services CU1920×1115 106 KB   Importance of an Auction Services CU1914×1113 160 KB   Vision1920×1121 171 KB   Strategy1920×1119 114 KB   Anticipated Challenges1920×1114 125 KB   Our Solutions1920×1123 122 KB   MVP1920×1117 172 KB   Auctions1920×1113 155 KB   Details1920×1110 157 KB   Directly Swap into Profit1920×1117 161 KB   Swap transaction1920×1102 178 KB   Maker liquidations1920×1119 167 KB   1920×1104 169 KB   1920×1127 187 KB   1920×1106 177 KB   Kovan1920×1105 162 KB   Metamask1916×1112 173 KB   Dark mode1920×1107 168 KB   Post MVP Roadmap1918×1109 130 KB   CU Dai Budget1920×1118 173 KB   Questions?1920×1120 155 KB   Questions 24:25 - Payton Rose: All this makes much sense for the crypto collaterals. Do you have plans to do these types of services for any of RWA integrations as well? 25:29 - Juan Guillén: Regarding the simulations you do, how do you simulate a situation like Black Thursday? You would need congestion, high prices, and inaccessibility. Is that even possible, or do you have to take each event separately and hope for the worst? 26:41 - Juan Guillén: Regarding anything that is coming in the future and how you are managing your backlog, right now, you seem to be focused on users and accessibility, which is great, and I am happy to see that. Have you also considered any type of integrations with exchanges or any other type of automatic bots or keepers that would run these auctions as well? Can you comment on that a bit? 28:35 - Payton Rose: In terms of the MKR package, is that going to be distributed to the company of Sidestream, or is it going to individual contributors? 29:13 - Juan Guillén: Regarding the process where we are, the proposal is in RFC. What is your idea and your plan to move forward? Is it to get feedback from the community? Are you in campaigning mode and trying to show the value? What is the stage here? 30:07 - Juan Guillén: What is the best way of reaching out for anyone watching the recording? 31:11 - Juan Guillén: Are you going to set up any channels for the community to reach out to propose, for example, new features? Do you have any plans for that? Can you comment on it?  Closing Comment  Juan Guillén  Outro 31:56  Thank you for presenting. I see your progress quite often from the SES perspective. It is always great to comment a bit and to share with the broader Maker community. Thank you for taking the time to be here. Let us keep the discussions and the feedback going at forum.makerdao.com. If you have any questions for Daniel or the team, feel free to reach out.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
